page.title: 17TOURISM
page.content: We have one National Trust property in our area. It is the waterfall at Glenoe. There is small walk near the waterfall and around the small valley the water created. In Raloo is a very old graveyard which attracts visitors. In this graveyard are the remains of an old church which was derelict in 1622. The oldest grave we can find is dated 1691 and the most recent is 1982. In our area we have various standing stones and a field which is known as Bruce's Field because it is said that Robert the Bruce fought a battle there. This field is at the back of Shaw's Farm.
